etymologies: mid 16th century: from Spanish manati, from Carib manáti

definitions: an aquatic mammal with a rounded tail flipper, living in shallow coastal waters and adjacent rivers of the tropical Atlantic.

notes.text: Family Trichechidae and genus Trichechus: three species, all of which are endangered, including the West Indian manatee (T. manatus)

shortDefinitions: sea cow of tropical Atlantic coasts and estuaries
